text:
I am somewhat new to vaping so like most people I asked friends about the best places locally to shop for ejuice and supplies. Following a recommendation I checked out e vapor shop. Found the staff friendly and helpful and found an "atomic Fireball" ejuice that was excellent tasting vaped really nicely.
After purchasing this flavor and several others I was happy Happy Happy!
The fireball is an extreme flavor  and I can not vape it all day so it was on the shelve with many other juices that I like. A few days pass and I feel the urge for a fireball and when i pick the bottle up I notice that it had actually crystallized in the bottle. doing some web searching found a solution and tried it but that didn't really work out as i had hoped. I returned to the EVAPOR SHOPPE and asked them about the problem and after looking at the ejuice the young man there apologized and stated that the store policy was no refund or exchanges. So I am stuck with a 30ml bottle of God knows what and they didnt give a rats a** at all. BUYER BEWARE! Plenty of shoppes in the area so I will never do business at this one again.

name: Greg Pennington
text: Hey Joseph A Bank, why don't you just sell each individual piece of clothing at a reasonable price instead of clustering multiple items when you pay a lot of money for one item. So confusing just simmer down a bit. I thought that you would like a review with some down to earth language!

name: Andrew Hamiter
text:
I purchased a shirt from this location and came back to exchange the shirt for a larger size without a receipt.  First, I was told that they do not return items that have been worn.  Moments later, the "manager" told me that they would buy it back for 50%.  I asked the "manager", "is it not true that you send shirts to the dry cleaners after they have been tried on?"  He replied, "yes".  I asked, "but, you can't take this shirt back and have it dry cleaned with the rest of them?"  He shook his head.  I asked for the manager and he said, "I am the manager".

they took my information and put it in the system when I purchased the shirt, so there is a record of my purchase.

The last experience that i will ever have with the store left a sour taste.  The sales staff, mainly the "manager", left me highly disappointed in their professionalism, honesty, and concern to make it right.  I drove to another location and they exchanged my item for a larger size without too much hassle.

My advice:  Go to another brand name store for quality service.  My friend, who is a former Jos A.
Bank employee, recommended that I take my future business to Brooks Brothers at the Summit.  I forward that advice to all of you.

name: Robert Levy
text: Great men's clothes and employees. "Regular price" is rediculously high. Only buy with good sale

text: I had the absolute worst experience at the Brookwood Village Jos A. Bank. I used them for my groom and groomsman suits for my June wedding. Every time one of the men would go to get sized or pick up something, I was called and asked questions that were answered by simply looking at their computers. I felt like I was constantly just telling them how to do their job. Also, some of the suits still did not fit properly even after getting fitted. I would not recommend them to anyone!!

name: Carson Landers
text:
I normally don't do reviews, but I've had so many bad experience with three Jos. A. Banks stores that I'm going to go on an adventure. Here I go.

Part 1:
This particular store was the worst of all. My wife (now) and I walked in, walked up to an employee that was just standing there drinking a soda not doing anything, and told him that we were getting married - that we needed to buy 12 suits for their buy 1 get 3 free sale. That's right. 12 suits. He looks at us with a blank stare and just points off in the distance and says that we can look over there for some.

Later on, we get someone that actually knows how to communicate. He doesn't know how to fuit someone for a suit even though he tries but does horribly, but then he keeps running off to the first guy we walked up to to tell him sorry for taking his customer. We were never his customer to begin with.

My wife and I were completely stressed out after this. I could go on about other details, but in the end we walked out. We were going to buy 12 suits, but they couldn't care less. I haven't had this poor of service in a long time even though buying a suit is where customer service is supposed to be very important.

Meet me again in Part 2 at the Huntsville, AL Bridge Street store.

name: Y Liu
text:
Manager Paul has poor customer skills and called police on me to ask me leave. Paul is very unreasonable and has his sole management discretion about me (Asian and new to America).
Police told me not to come in this store ever again just because manager Paul wanted so for no reasons. It really hurts a new customer's feelings.

Bryan,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Rest assured this will be addressed with the regional and store management team of our Birmingham, AL location for review and training purposes. We’d love to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you’d like to discuss this with us in greater detail, please email your preferred contact info and the best time to reach you to at JABListens@josabank.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
JAB Listens

text: At first I would have gave 5 stars because they were friendly people they fit me in without an appointment. But then I few months after they installed my music it all started going out one speaker at a time until the point where no sound at all was coming out. So after that I decided to take matters into my own hands because I used to install music myself years ago. upon removing the panels from my doors an getting to the back of the speakers it was obvious that the wiring used on my speakers was very cheap because it had already dry rotted after a few months. I was able to get all my speakers back working again but then a few months after that they're already going back out only two of the speakers are working. so all-in-all I am not too happy about the job that was done on my vehicle.

resp.text:
Hi Mr. King.

Unless we're installing an amplifier or have reason to suspect that there is an issue with the wiring we just use the factory wire that's in the vehicle.

We also give you lifetime warranty on your labor. So if there was an issue you could have brought it back to us to check it out at no charge

name: FeC ENG
text:
Overall, we had a good experience at the store, but it was a little odd.

We started out strong meeting a representative, Kate. Who greeted us, was quick, proactive, we liked her. But this other guy cut in and pushed her out. We (myself and the family) liked her. She was respectful, addressed us as soon as we walked in the door, gave us her name, and seemed really easy to work with. The other guy just felt like a salesmen.

We ALL wish we could have kept working with her. I, girlfriend to the stud getting the suits, wish the other guy did not push her out. I wanted her opinion. A young, fashionable, professional woman brings a lot to the table when it comes to attire. I would have respected her input. I hope the company allows her to work closely with clients in the future.

Please note that I have rented suits for myself from Men's Wearhouse so I am also a customer (being a woman in engineering, my friends end up being guys so I end up on the grooms side).

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  We apologize for the service difference you experienced in our Birmingham location between Kate and the other associate.  Your shopping experience should be easy and stress free regardless of who you are working with.  We have forwarded this feedback to the management team for review and training purposes so we can improve.  We look forward to an opportunity to better serve you in the future.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

text: My daughter was getting married and I had to rent a tuxedo. I was expecting to be there for a while but the employees couldn't have been more friendly and knowledgeable. The tux was also unbelievably comfortable. If you need shirts, ties, socks etc. they sell these as well. If have recommended to numerous friends and will continue to do so.

name: Stephanie Williams-Velazquez
text: I went to pick a tuxedo for my nephew. I was picking it up because on the previous day when my nephew went to get it, it apparently had been sent to the wrong store. I get there and someone had picked it up from the correct store and neglected to call and inform him. I get to the place where suit was suppose to be and it is too big and no sizes to fit even though he was fitted weeks ago. It is a few hours until the wedding and this child has to wear this if his mom can't find a suit to match.

resp.text:
Hi Stephanie, we are sorry to learn that there were so many issues with your nephew's order. This is certainly not the kind of service that we aim to offer. We would love to help.
Please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Eric Campbell
text: Very attentive, professional and knowledgeable staff. All of my expectations were exceeded. Will shop there again.

name: smjaygal
text: NOT AL ALL CHEAP. That said, this place offers high quality clothing of the suit variety from shoes to shirts. We went here to get my husband fitted for wedding clothes and yes they do that for free and won't throw you out for looking like you can't afford a pocket square. I would absolutely recommend this chain for suit lovers who can afford to drop well over 700 on a full suit.

name: Izz Noland
text:
I have been 5 times already for registering and fitting for my wedding which is now only 5 days from today. My measurements were wrong the first time, so I went back and saw the manager. She measured again and changed everything. When I received my suit for the final fitting, everything was as per the original measurements and too big. They are supposed to overnight my new suit which I'll see 3 days before my wedding.
In addition, my son is very small, and I asked for the smallest fit. He received a regular slim fit instead of extreme slim fit which looks baggy. I was told by the person on duty that they don't have extreme slim fit for children (my son is 11, so I'm paying full price for his rental). I don't believe this to be true and will be speaking with the manager soon. I will not recommend them to anyone else. All of my groomsmen and father of the bride are using them, and the father of the bride at a different Men's Warehouse didn't receive his shoes. I can't believe we're paying $200 / person for all of the hiccups during the preparation phase.

EDIT / UPDATE - My new arrival came in a couple of days before my wedding and fit fine.  In the shuffle, the new order had a white shirt instead of ivory and I didn't realize until the day of my wedding that my shirt was ALL wrong!  Luckily Newnan in GA was able to fix me up.  My mom drove over an hour both ways to get me an ivory shirt.
Meanwhile, I'm waiting on my custom suit.  They were supposed to make up for ALL of this with a "special" custom suit, and there's nothing different about the one I am receiving versus any other Joe Custom Suit.  (mind you there were 7-8 in the bridal party who all rented suits from Men's Warehouses across the Southeast who all had some sort of issue).
I went in yesterday to pick up after my final fitting a week ago, and they had not touched it.  I was told on a Tuesday I could come get it on the weekend.  No calls, no emails, nothing.  So I go in AFTER the weekend and it had not been touched and they said, "wait 10 minutes and we'll have it ready."  NO!  I don't want my custom suit rushed.  I should add that customer service reply 4 months ago gave me a nice discount on my rental, and Kyla and David mean well at this location, but they can't, and shouldn't walk behind all of their employees.
This is the worst experience I've ever had with any establishment in the US. PERIOD. FULL STOP.

resp.text:
We appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. We sincerely apologize for all the errors faced in getting the rental garments ready for such a special occasion. We have passed your feedback along to the upper management team for review and training purposes. We’d love the opportunity to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you'd like to discuss your visit with us in greater detail, please email us your wedding group details and best contact number or email at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so a member of our team can follow up with you.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Andrea Bedor
text: Tyler assisted my husband and I with purchasing a suit for our anniversary. He was extremely helpful and loads of fun while we were shopping. He made sure that we were prepared for our special event. They were able to accommodate our very short timeline and they did same day alterations.Thanks Tyler!

name: Agent Phrosty
text: Easiest time I've ever had buying a suit. Zachary was very knowledgeable and understood our needs. He more than exceeded our expectations and helped find me two sharp suits with matching shoes for a price that didn't break my budget.

name: Joel West
text: I had a great visit the other day. The prices are not the cheapest but to some extent, you get what you pay for. I had a store assistant named Marcus Lyles. He greeted me as soon as I walked in the door. He spent alot of time with me making sure I got everything I needed, that it fit correctly, and looked good. His expertise is priceless and I will shop there again because of him. Great job  Marcus!

name: Samantha Hall
text: My husband is 6'2" and 270lbs. His clothes from Men's Wearhouse always fit great.

name: Guy Able
text: Excellent customer service. I visited for a suit fitting and rental for a wedding party and had a great experience. Knowledgable and courteous staff. In and out in less than 20 minutes. Will return in the future.

name: Thomas Weeks
text: Really great service. Met me at the door and was very personable. Great knowledge and knew exactly how to help me. Without a doubt, will come back.

name: John
text: I had a pleasant experience when it came to this location. Everyone was friendly and worked quickly to get our order done.

name: Lynn Rickard
text: Very helpful and friendly, quick to serve and got us in and out in no time!

name: Shealynn Seaman
text: Ask for Caroline Stephen's! She helped us find the perfect suit for a special mother son outing. Can't say enough about her attention to detail and excellent level of customer service! We will be back!!

name: Christopher Godlewski
text: STAY AWAY!!  This place takes customer service and respect to a new low.  Purchased a jacket to wear IN MY OWN WEDDING, was promised to have it in 2 days . . . delayed going out of town just to get the jacket and it wasn't ready.  Had a bunch of items ordered for possible purchase; was told they'd be in on Wednesday and to just come on in.  Thought better of it and called, no sign of them.  Called back on Friday, the items had been there for days.  The Assistant Manager tells me "sorry, I work with a bunch of idiots".  He then tries to sell me a jacket that's not even close to fitting in the shoulders and tells me "I can just get it altered".  Anyone who knows anything about jackets knows if the shoulders don't fit, the jacket doesn't fit.  Tried to order even more items to exchange for a jacket I'd gotten, can't even get the AM to call me back after he again blamed the "part-timers" that work for him.  DON'T EVEN WASTE YOUR TIME HERE.  They should either close this branch or fire everyone and start over.

name: LuckyCharm Gaming
text: Very friendly customer service and very knowledgeable about their suits

name: Echo5191 Cade
text: Got fitted for a tux , it came in a week early so I went to pick it up and  they messed up the color of Vest/ bow tie and pants were way to big , anyway they said they would over night and a week later I just got the call they had it , and they still don’t have it ! My event is Friday and if it’s not in before then  my prom will be ruined! DO NOT EVER GET ANYTHING HERE!! And the staff is extremely incompetent and are Poorly trained !

resp.text:
Echo,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.  If you'd like to discuss your experience with us in greater detail, please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: William Dennison
text: Save your time and money. These guys hardly know what they're doing. The only reason I gave it two stars instead of one is that Zack was actually helpful and fixed the mess for me.

name: Charles Worthington
text: Very impressed with the service at this store. The manager, David, took care of us, was helpful with recommendations and was my personal favorite characteristic, fast.  We were in and out in 20 min.  The reviews are certainly not representative of the level of professionalism at this store. Great work.

name: John Thomas
text: Great store! Tyler was my salesman and did a wonderful job. Will definitely use again.

name: Ronald Forte
text: Really enjoyed the service here. Got all my stuff late but they were right on time. Awesome team!

name: Mike James
text: This Men's Wearhouse is a step above the others in my experience. Marlena and Jeremy are both super awesome and they go above and beyond to provide the best customer experience possible.

name: Chris Barry
text: I was impressed. First time to a Bham Men's Warehouse and was reluctant to visit this location based on previous reviews. New management has done a great job working to right the ship. John was an attentive and patient salesman.

name: Jamie Long
text: The staff here were very friendly and attentive. They were able to help us find what we were looking for in a timely manner.

name: Anthony Colón
text:
I am not having the best service to say the least. The buying process was great,  however, we are now almost a month out from my promised date for my custom made suit. Originally, I needed it for my graduation and was able to wear another suit for that event. They said customs take longer than the original date I was promised, May 9th. They said it would arrive on May 20th instead and I would receive a phone call. No call on that date, I called on the 23rd and it was there. They refitted my pants which is great, and the jacket fits perfect, but said it would arrive today, June 4th. It has not arrived yet.

I think the frustrating part is not that I don't have it, but that it is not ready by the promised date they said it would arrive. Perhaps, better communication would be helpful too. I have another event this weekend I would need it by and hope it arrives before the end of this week.

I feel this is a costly mistake on my end and will be wiser in any future purchases.

(Edit: wrote to email from Men's Warehouse a few days ago and haven't received a response.

Today, June 12th, I called the store and my suit was ready for pick-up. Again, why was I never contacted as they initially said they would reach out to me and let me know when it arrived?

Ideally, I would like to hear a response from Men's Warehouse and hopefully give them input so they can improve with their customer service.)

resp.text:
Anthony,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. We would love to reach out to the store and have your concern addressed. If you'd like to discuss your experience with us in greater detail, please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.

name: Mark Cline
text: For both fitting and picking up a tuxedo rental the staff were not only very professional but extremely friendly and personable. They took the time to make sure everything was done correctly and fit to look my best for the wedding.

name: Sean
text: Nice clothes but sales they have are pretty inflated. Sales staff is nice and they have a good selection.

name: Drew Debter
text:
If you are looking for great professional service ask for Zachary Guest! He gave us great deals and knew exactly what we were looking for! Even ordered sizes they didn't have with free shipping. Thank you Zach for your amazing customer service!
- Drew, Blake, and Spivey

name: Preston Smith
text: Excellent customer service. Marcus, Tyler, Marlena, and Alozono helped me with my Tux rental. Assisted with immediate alterations. Great atmosphere.

name: Ashley Mealins
text: My fiancé got his suit for our wedding here and had such a wonderful experience! The staff was so helpful and friendly :)

name: FRANK Black
text: Always a great experience ,satisfying experience. Need more XLong selection.

name: Bonnie Blue
text: Good prices and service

name: ARNOLD MOSTELLA
text: Great customer service the staff was very helpful. Nice place to shop for everything a man would like to buy

name: ARNOLD MOSTELLA
text: Great customer service the staff was very helpful. Nice place to shop for everything a man would like to buy

name: Everything Bham
text: I went for a fitting and I asked the gentleman that if my friend that asked me to be in his wedding was paying for the rest of the balance,which had been the case in the weddings i had been in the past, will i be able to get my $20 back and he said i had like 2 weeks or something like that from the day i came in so i got fitted on Oct.26 and then went in Oct. 28 and talked to a sweet young lady and she said that since it was not before 2 weeks I couldn't get my $20 back which i was not told at the beginning. I used to work in retail and i would always double check everything and that gentleman said he was sure i could get my $20 back. I would not go here ever again cause the incompetence is awful!! I wouldn't have been fitted if i knew i couldn't get my $20 back.

name: Mitzi Matzke
text: Don’t rent a Tux from here. Very misleading regarding pricing.  Zack should not be working in retail!  Would not even listen to me when I tried to explain what we were told when fitted and placed order.

name: Sean
text: Nice clothes but sales they have are pretty inflated. Sales staff is nice and they have a good selection.

name: Trop p
text: Great Staff. Came in for tux rental. Made adjustments in quick time. Overall A+ service.

name: Nate Pagel
text: Great service. I needed a rush job on a tux and they served me quickly and politely and were able to get my tux to Chicago on time.

name: Christopher Gonzalez-Tablada
text: Great service! Had me in and out in no time to get fitted for a tux. Couldn’t have asked for anything more.

name: Jack Frost
text: Zach was an awesome salesman with style and patience. This gentleman helped me find the perfect match to a sports coat I recently bought. If you come in ask for Zach!

name: FRANK Black
text: Always a great experience ,satisfying experience. Need more XLong selection.

name: Bonnie Blue
text: Good prices and service

name: D Watts
text: Avoid! Go to Patton Creek store. They don't know what they are doing at 280 location. Customer is never right. Only person that was perfect at their job on 280 was Hakim Derkaoui, but I haven't seen him in the store the last 5+ visits. Stick to Patton Creek.

name: James Kines
text: They were very helpful in directing me, with it being my first time being fitted for a wedding, and very patient.

name: Stephanie Wardlaw
text: Wonderful service. This was a last minute suit rental and they took great care of us!

name: Cory Truett
text: Helpful staff and good selection. I had a great experience with these guys taking care of me when I was picking out a suit for my wedding.

name: Anita Lockett
text: Great service and was so helpful to my husband, who was asked at the last minute to fill in for a groomsman who drop out the wedding a week before.

name: jimmy harrell
text: This is by far the most unprofessional, lazy, piss poor excuse for a Men's Wearhouse I've ever seen. I spent over $800 on a suit then left it to be "tailored" 5 days later I arrive to pick up my freshly "tailored" suit (WRONG!!) Waist was to tight and the jacket hadn't been touched. I had to leave it for another couple hours why they fixed it. Finally I get the suit and it fit like an $800 suit should. They bag it up, offer no apology for the troubles or delay, and send me on my way. I drive 2 hours home only to find that the idiots didn't bag the tie and pocket square purchased with the suit. I call to inquire about it and the "manager" says yea it's here....you can come pick it back up whenever you get a chance I don't really have another alternative for you. Talk about PISSED!!! Save yourself the trouble and steer clear of this location. The personnel from the top down obviously don't know the meaning of Customer Service.

name: Doug Howell
text:
Great service. Great deals.
Got two jackets on a bogo. Tyler was a great help.

name: Channdra Isom Law
text: Marlena and Hayden were very helpful with the process of getting the remainder of our groomsman tux paid off. 10/10

name: Just Ro
text: This Men’s Warehouse had an excellent staff, friendly and helpful  Marlena,Marcus,  and Katie were very helpful I will be back in the future.

name: Jack Frost
text: Zach was an awesome salesman with style and patience. This gentleman helped me find the perfect match to a sports coat I recently bought. If you come in ask for Zach!

name: Channdra Isom Law
text: Marlena and Hayden were very helpful with the process of getting the remainder of our groomsman tux paid off. 10/10

name: Anita Lockett
text: Great service and was so helpful to my husband, who was asked at the last minute to fill in for a groomsman who drop out the wedding a week before.

name: Derrick Howlett
text: Everyone there is really nice. The customer service is outstanding

name: Dez Mitchell
text: Jeremy and Tyler were amazing in helping me and my buddy out for our dinner plans

name: Tyler Laymon
text: I have dealt with this store in years past and everything went smooth and as expected. This time however was a totally different story. We are not doing the conventional rent a tux for the groomsman thing, we are buying pants, shirt, belt, tie, etc. for the guys since it will end being just as cheap or cheaper and everyone will have some new clothes. All that said we just wanted to get the shirts from them and buy all the other stuff elsewhere. From the beginning it was a fiasco and it never got any better. They are super nice, but they are incompetent, unorganized, unprofessional idiots. During my last visit the assistant manager actually argued, heated might I say, with a customer. They aren't able to keep up with what's going on and the other employees have no clue what the other is doing. How can you run this type of business without everyone in the store knowing what's going on, so when customer comes in to check on an order and no one on the floor knows what the other is doing. This is extremely frustrating and I doubt I will ever use the Men's Wearhouse franchise again due to this horrible experience.

name: Jarrod Walker
text: I see a lot of negative reviews from a while back for this location, but my experience couldnt be further from the truth! Zach was very attentive while helping multiple customers (including myself). He helped me find some good deals and some styles that help me look professional without trying to upsell me. I can't speak to the other salespeople, but if you go in while Zach is there, you'll get good advice.

name: Marsha Lynn
text: No complaints here, nice staff and helpful. My husband found a suit and shoes that suited him.. clean store.

name: Ben Johnson
text: Great service. Tuxe was there on time. Very helpful

name: Scott Pierce
text: Always a great selection, great sales, and great service. Love this place!

name: Joseph Hobaugh
text: Save yourself the hassle, drive another 15min and go to the Men's Warehouse at 3664 Riverchase Galleria, Hoover, AL 35244...this 280 store doesn't have their stuff figured out yet. Took over 3 weeks just to get the order placed for a tux for my brother's wedding, including two trips to the store and having to call the store multiple times to find out what is going on (instead of them calling to update on the status).

name: Ed E
text: Professional and efficient service for tux rental with an immediate in house alteration

name: Audrey Channell
text: Great experience.  Very thorough with measurements.

name: Kel
text: I went in to pick up my tux in march it was the day before the wedding and the tux didnt fit anywhere I ran out the dressing panicking and Zack looked at me like chill dude I got you lol, he adjusted it (which I didnt know you could do) and it fitted perfect he was very professional and laid back I will return and recommend to others

name: Christopher Ray
text: Great experience. Very friendly and excellent service.

name: K D
text: Good service and merchandise.  Helpful staff.

name: natalie marko
text: We had great Customers Service both times were in over the last 2 months. I would highly recommend as a good place to shop for quality suits and specials.

name: Kabrina Lester (The Sweet Life)
text: Got meassured for my tux for my wedding and the jacket came in a whole size bigger than what I was messured for. Also the button up shirt had the buttons on the wrong side of the left sleeve .

name: Scott Pierce
text: Always a great selection, great sales, and great service. Love this place!

name: Mark Adams
text: Of the three tuxes that were fitted at this location, all three were returned as they were several sizes too small. I looked like Chris Farley dressed as a Chippendales dancer (and I'm not a big person). When the correct tuxes did arrive, they were wrinkled beyond belief. If wrinkled tuxes that are so tight that they cannot be buttoned are your thing, I highly recommend this place.

name: Jessica
text: Absolute worst service ever! My husband went in to get fitted for/pay for a suit for a friends wedding and we had to make 2 trips back to the store that day due to errors on the staff's part. Then my husband went to pick up the suit he has PAID for already and they told him it isnt in yet which it should have been because it had already been a month. One phone call to corporate the suit is magically found so my husband makes yet another trip to the store. Then once he picks the suit up the belt and dress shirt are missing which our receipt clearly states that he has already paid for. We purchased this suit in February and we are still dealing with them to get everything we paid for!! Will never go back once we get everything we have paid for!!!!

name: Doug Hartman
text: I am hard to fit and John took care of me and had me looking good in my new dress shirts for work.

name: Justin Marden
text: Very polite and helpful staff, they assisted me with my tux rental for a wedding. When I picked up my tux, I was in and out in under 20 minutes.

name: Shana Flury
text: Rented a tux and it was completely the wrong size. Had it sent back to be fixed and they promised it would be ready the day of the wedding. It was not, they have no record of the reorder and have nothing to replace it with. While on the phone with them they put me on hold 9 times, and each time a new employee answered the phone where I had to explain the situation again and again. Employees acted like they had never handled a suit fitting before. Will never use men's wearhouse again.

name: Kelsey Chapman
text:
Do NOT go to this store. We had a pretty bad experience with them. I went with my fiance and two brothers to buy them suits for the wedding, and weren't treated very well. My middle brother wears camouflage, jeans and boots all the time and obviously the employees there aren't used to seeing that and deem anyone who does wear it beneath them because there was a very rude comment made about my brother behind his back but within earshot. After our 2 hour trip there, he had to use the restroom, on his way to the restroom he passes by an employee helping a mother and her son. The employee proceeds the comment after seeing my brother "what is that?" And laughs with the mother and son he's currently helping. Strike one. You can tell the man helping us deems it beneath him also because he acted like it pained him to be seen with us and halfway measured them for tailoring until we told him more needed to be done to make the suits look like they should. Strike 2. They tell us at checkout that the suits will be ready in two weeks on a specific date and we could come pick them up. My fiance and I make a special trip again to come pick them up, get there and they have to search for our order and lo and behold....it's not ready. But "don't worry. It will be ready tomorrow. You can just get it then." No we can't because we have to drive for 2 hours and can't just keep doing that on a whim. Not a call, email or anything informing us that the suits weren't ready. I firmly believe they had just stuffed them into the back room and forgotten about them. Strike 3. We have yet to go back to pick up the order because we haven't found the time but I'm waiting for the next mishap. So if you were to ask me, NO do not go to this location. Terrible service. Rude and think they're better.

Let me add: After going the 2nd time to pick the suits up. We had to wait almost 20 minutes for them to locate and 'steam' our suits when we had already called on the way to let them know we were coming to pick them up. Get home with my fiance and he tries everything on, the suit fit good but the shirt was the wrong size and they gave one of my brothers the completely wrong colored vest.

name: Hayden Rankin
text: When I tell you what an experience!! I mean WOW what an amazing experience I had at this location!! Joseph Damico needs to be payed more money!! They need to give this guy a raise! Wonderful customer service from Mr. Damico! I came in the store with expectations of getting a couple ties, and BOOM!! Before I knew it he upsold me and I ended up walking out of there with almost 3000$ of merchandise! Great salesman! I wanted to hire him myself! He as very enthusiastic and says he is ABBOUD! Haha great guy! I told my wife I wanted to pay him to be around me all day!! Lol if you are needing any clothes go to Men's Wearhouse on 280 and ask for Joseph Damico!

name: Christie Estes
text:
To echo what the previous posters have said; it is very unfortunate that you cannot give 0 stars. Better yet, I would assign a negative number if that were an option. If you do not read any further, the takeaway is this: Run don't walk to Jos. A. Bank for tuxedo rentals. I have never encountered such incompetence or ignorance as I have at Men's Wearhouse.

Where shall I begin. . . If you go to Men's Wearhouse you will be lectured ad nauseum about the importance of everyone in your wedding party providing the group number at the fitting. Great in theory. In reality, we were given the incorrect group number. Thankfully, one of the groomsmen caught the error and provided us the correct number. Yes, let that sink in. No one at Men's Wearhouse was competent enough to provide the number. Don't stress the importance of something and then screw it up. We were, of course, offered no explanation as to why we were given the incorrect number.

Moving on to the next issue. I had a coupon from a bridal magazine that I provided during our initial visit. This coupon was to be applied to each tuxedo rental (14 total). Do you think it was applied? Of course not. It came to our attention when several groomsmen commented on the cost of the tuxedo rentals. Of course, there was no explanation for why the coupon was not applied.

At this point, it is Thursday morning and we are getting married on Saturday. Have they called to tell my fiancee that his tuxedo is ready? Of course not.

And, here's the best part of the story, every time I have called to point out some screw up, the phone is answered "Hi. This is _____. How can I provide you with world class service today?" Well, start with doing your job and being competent. But that isn't going to happen. Go to Jos. A. Bank and save yourself the headaches.

name: Melinda Henkel
text: After all of the guys had gone and gotten fitted and paid in full for their tuxes, we ended up having a HORRIBLE experience. Only one of the tuxes fitted right upon pickup. One of the guys had pants that were shorts and 10 sizes too big with a vest that was 5 sizes too big, they wouldn't do ANYTHING to fix it because try to give new pants that didn't match. The junior groomsmen's jacket was too small. One of the shirts had sleeves that were 3/4 type sleeves instead of full length meaning he couldn't remove his jacket. It was horrible and I am still not done, we deserve to have our money back.

name: Michael Koratich (BioGuy)
text: Service is exceptional price even at BOGO is a bit steep.

name: amy deloach
text:
There are far too many things wrong with this store. Where do I begin?

I'd give zero stars for this particular location, but 1. you can't give 0 stars on Google Reviews, and 2. we did actually have a good experience renting our wedding tuxes with one of the managers Homer (who is the only competent employee here, so I give a star to Homer. And well, we didn't actually pick up the wedding tuxes at this location, just placed the order, but I'm pretty sure if we did get them from here something would've gone wrong.) but everything else we have tried to do at this store was a complete fail.

My husband ordered a couple suits and two pairs of pants to get alterations done. They completely wonked up the alterations and made the suit look like a baggy potato sack. We actually did extensive research on how men's suits should fit and the finished product didn't turn out to look anything like the books.

Not only were the alterations terrible but they weren't completed on time. Something about the pants not being shipped on time, but they were smart on their part and gave us a phone call to tell us it wasn't ready when they said it would be.

After the messed up all the alterations my husband went back for a second fitting to have them fix the problem. The first suit was completed in a timely manner and turned out exactly how he wanted it to be. They told him to come back the next Saturday and the other suit and two pairs of pants would be done by then.

This is where things get screwy. The second suit's alterations were completely off, and it seemed like no one had touched them. Pair of pants #1 were even longer and baggier than the pants on the suit, like they definitely were not touched or tailored whatsoever. They were too long by a good 4-5 inches and too baggy in the waist. ON TOP OF ALL THIS PAIR OF PANTS #2 WAS NOT DONE AND NO ONE HAD CALLED OR INFORMED US THEY WERE NOT READY. They said the tailor had left for the day. SO WE HAD DRIVEN AN HOUR TO GO TO THIS STORE TO PICK UP NOTHING BECAUSE ALL THE ALTERATIONS WERE WRONG AND THE ORDER WASN'T EVEN COMPLETED.

It is very very very clear that some managers in here are not doing their jobs correctly. I came here on a Saturday night - the store was a mess. There were ties and handkerchiefs not hung up, hangers not spaced evenly apart, the phone was ringing of the hook and no one was picking it up, and all the employees were either watching TV and I believe the manager was outside on his cell phone. It is clear that the tailors, or at least one of them doesn't have a brain and is completely incompetent. I understand that these people are most likely overworked or underpaid but it is such a disappointment to receive poor customer service in our economy because there are plenty of people who are more intelligent and harder working that can't find jobs because schmucks like the people at Men's Wearhouse are getting paid to watch TV, talk on their cell phones, and leave work before getting their jobs done.

This store is a joke and it is pathetic. We will never ever be back again.

name: Alex Green
text: They measured me and had my suit tailored and ready in only a week with good buys and good deals.

name: Jacob Roberts
text: If you're in the market for some really nice men's clothing this is the place for you! There's always a deal going on too.

name: K P
text: The managers at this store are completely incompetent and unhelpful. Please do not shop there! I should have read the reviews before walking in the door and it would have saved me hours of stress. We tried to do a wedding through this store and it has taken 5 phone calls over a month period to even get the information put into the system so the groomsmen can order their suits. I have been so disappointed with the way the problem has been handled because there has been nothing but lies and excuses. The sales staff give the impression that they are helpful but once you walk out the door they do not follow through on their word. I was told this store got an entirely new staff based on poor performance in the past... it's time to get new management again. I will never go back and I warn all of you to do the same.

name: Popo DelFuego
text: Needed clothes for a funeral, the sales rep attempted to take advantage of the situation by only showing items grater than $500. All in all, an entirely positive experience and when I'm in the market for additional formal attire, this store will be where I go first.

text: Steve was a good guy, answered the questions I had.

name: Adam Foutz
text:
I hate leaving bad reviews, but this store deserves it. I needed a new suit for a wedding, and went in to order my suit well in advance. A pair of pants had to be ordered, no big deal. After 3 weeks of not hearing anything from them, I called and was told "we'll call you back." No call back. So, I called again a few days later and spoke to the store manager. I was then told "I'll call you back before lunch." Guess what? No call back. I was up against a deadline, and gave them well over a month to get a PAIR OF PANTS in and get an entire suit tailored.

After calling numerous times, I physically went up to the store and got my money refunded. The manger was there and knew who I was, and offered to get it tailored same day. Too late, I ended up having to rent a suit for my event. I highly suggest going elsewhere to find a suit in Montgomery, this store is incompetent. Spend the extra money elsewhere.

name: Billy Coogan
text:
I own a local business and the folks at Visual Effects & Vinyl Solutions are a blessing to have so close to us to do business with.

They do our t-shirts, polos, business cards, vehicle wraps and decals, vinyl banners and we are always happy with the product and ordering processes. A++++

name: Aricka Brazer
text:
Placed a simple order for vinyl stickers with them and they asked me to come back in 2 days. I can buy a product that is five times larger with my manufacturer for the same price This guy was going to charge me for this smaller order.

I came back 3 days later and they couldn't find my order. They called the vinyl person and he didn't answer so she told  me to come back later...not a time. Just later. I left a note with what I was there for and what I needed. Came back 2 hours later and Found out the guy had come back and left again and he did not make them. When the service girl called again he barked he at her to tell me to come back at 4. I don't think so. I left and said don't worry about it.

Bottom line. Wouldn't go back. Wouldn't recommend them. Not good customer service. If he didn't want to do my order he shouldn't have wasted my time.
